publicwhip.spmotion: *S1M-1479 Rhoda Grant: City of Inverness-That the Parliament congratulates Inverness on becoming Scotland's first Millennium city; pays tribute to local people who have fought a long running campaign to achieve city status for the town and, in particular, acknowledges the contribution of David Stewart, MP for Inverness East, Nairn and Lochaber, who has campaigned for city status for ten years.
S1M-1479 City of Inverness (lodged on 18 December 2000) Dr Elaine Murray*

S1M-1479 Rhoda Grant: City of Inverness—That the Parliament congratulates Inverness on becoming Scotland’s first Millennium city; pays tribute to local people who have fought a long running campaign to achieve city status for the town and, in particular, acknowledges the contribution of David Stewart, MP for Inverness East, Nairn and Lochaber, who has campaigned for city status for ten years. Supported by: Dr Elaine Murray
S1M-1479 City of Inverness (lodged on 18 December 2000) Maureen Macmillan*, Scott Barrie*
S1M-1479 City of Inverness (lodged on 18 December 2000) Mr John Home Robertson*

S1M-1479 Rhoda Grant: City of Inverness—That the Parliament congratulates Inverness on becoming Scotland’s first Millennium city; pays tribute to local people who have fought a long running campaign to achieve city status for the town and, in particular, acknowledges the contribution of David Stewart, MP for Inverness East, Nairn and Lochaber, who has campaigned for city status for ten years. Supported by: Dr Elaine Murray, Maureen Macmillan, Scott Barrie, Mr John Home Robertson
S1M-1479 City of Inverness (lodged on 18 December 2000) Karen Whitefield*
S1M-1479 City of Inverness (lodged on 18 December 2000) Cathy Peattie*

S1M-1479 Rhoda Grant: City of Inverness—That the Parliament congratulates Inverness on becoming Scotland’s first Millennium city; pays tribute to local people who have fought a long running campaign to achieve city status for the town and, in particular, acknowledges the contribution of David Stewart, MP for Inverness East, Nairn and Lochaber, who has campaigned for city status for ten years. Supported by: Dr Elaine Murray, Maureen Macmillan, Scott Barrie, Mr John Home Robertson, Karen Whitefield, Cathy Peattie
S1M-1479 City of Inverness (lodged on 18 December 2000) Mr John Munro*, Pauline McNeill*

S1M-1479 Rhoda Grant: City of Inverness—That the Parliament congratulates Inverness on becoming Scotland’s first Millennium city; pays tribute to local people who have fought a long running campaign to achieve city status for the town and, in particular, acknowledges the contribution of David Stewart, MP for Inverness East, Nairn and Lochaber, who has campaigned for city status for ten years. Supported by: Dr Elaine Murray, Maureen Macmillan, Scott Barrie, Mr John Home Robertson, Karen Whitefield, Cathy Peattie, Mr John Munro, Pauline McNeill
S1M-1479 City of Inverness (lodged on 18 December 2000) Karen Gillon*

S1M-1479 Rhoda Grant: City of Inverness—That the Parliament congratulates Inverness on becoming Scotland’s first Millennium city; pays tribute to local people who have fought a long running campaign to achieve city status for the town and, in particular, acknowledges the contribution of David Stewart, MP for Inverness East, Nairn and Lochaber, who has campaigned for city status for ten years. Supported by: Dr Elaine Murray, Maureen Macmillan, Scott Barrie, Mr John Home Robertson, Karen Whitefield, Cathy Peattie, Mr John Munro, Pauline McNeill, Karen Gillon

S1M-1479 Rhoda Grant: City of Inverness—That the Parliament congratulates Inverness on becoming Scotland’s first Millennium city; pays tribute to local people who have fought a long running campaign to achieve city status for the town and, in particular, acknowledges the contribution of David Stewart, MP for Inverness East, Nairn and Lochaber, who has campaigned for city status for ten years. Supported by: Dr Elaine Murray, Maureen Macmillan, Scott Barrie, Mr John Home Robertson, Karen Whitefield, Cathy Peattie, Mr John Munro, Pauline McNeill, Karen Gillon

S1M-1479 Rhoda Grant: City of Inverness—That the Parliament congratulates Inverness on becoming Scotland’s first Millennium city; pays tribute to local people who have fought a long running campaign to achieve city status for the town and, in particular, acknowledges the contribution of David Stewart, MP for Inverness East, Nairn and Lochaber, who has campaigned for city status for ten years. Supported by: Dr Elaine Murray, Maureen Macmillan, Scott Barrie, Mr John Home Robertson, Karen Whitefield, Cathy Peattie, Mr John Farquhar Munro, Pauline McNeill, Karen Gillon
